July 7 2004 My conversations with Jim consistently leave me with either a pain from laughing too hard or a pain in head; in most cases it is both. Like too much salt on an expensive cut of perfectly grilled meat ...... His conversations leave you feeling painfully satisfied that you understood what he was saying but there is always the after taste of something more............ Water sometimes helps. For the past year I have been very slowly and painfully been getting over a bad break-up. This break-up was different from the others in my past and I truly wanted to take the time I needed to discover why I allowed myself to get here in the first place. My friends of course have helped me through this process every step of the way, each adding there own flavor of support. While the majority of my friends give me hugs when I need one or help me cry in beer to forget, Jim took on the role of helping me look inside. At first I was scared to go there but I really have truly learned so much about myself this year and I owe a lot of it to our sarcastically insightful, truthful and sometimes bitter and jaded conversations late at night. Recently I was wanting to set Jim up with a friend of mine........ He makes me laugh!! to re-cap our conversation for prosperity and future reference see below..... Re: Dating Younger Women Jim: Yeah, she'll meet me and she might even like me, but after awhile she'll realize that I'm too old for her. Karen: Oh come on, you have to get over the age thing. Jim: That's easy for you to say. I'll be the one with a broken heart. Karen: That's what I'm here for, to help mend broken hearts. Jim: Sure. That would be like a heroin addict offering to help someone get off crack. Thanks man ........The check is in the mail.
